content.webTitle: Horse racing: Hobbs: Ground no barrier to second Champion Hurdle for Rooster Booster

fields.headline: Hobbs booster for the Rooster
fields.bodyText: Philip Hobbs said yesterday that the ground will pose no problems for Rooster Booster as the grey attempts to win the Champion Hurdle for a second time at Cheltenham next Tuesday. "You could argue that Rooster Booster's best form is on good ground, although I think he can cope with anything," Hobbs said. "We are very happy with him, and everything has gone to plan since the Tote Gold Trophy. "At the moment he weighs 474kg and we'd like him to be 470kg on the day, the same weight as for his win last year." Hobbs will send an impressive team to the Festival meeting, and believes that Monkerhostin, who runs in the Coral Cup on Wednesday, and Made In Japan, his main hope for the Triumph Hurdle, both hold excellent chances. "Monkerhostin seems in very good form and the Coral Cup is definitely the target," Hobbs said. "He seemed to get the three miles [last time] but I do think the distance of the Coral race is ideal. "Made In Japan looks a lively outsider for the Triumph as he stays very well and I think he'll be better on the quicker ground." · The Jockey Club have confirmed it is to hold an investigation into jockey Sean Fox's controversial fall from Ice Saint at Fontwell Park on Monday. Fox will appeal against the 21-day ban he received after the stewards found him guilty of "stepping off" his horse.
